title: Dynamic Device - Usage Examples
description: Device mockups for showcasing apps, websites, and designs with scrolling animations and interactive features

examples.name: iPhone Mockup with Hover Scroll Screenshot
examples.description: Mobile app screenshot showcase with smooth hover scroll animation
examples.visualDescription: White iPhone frame with app screenshot that scrolls on hover, 3-second smooth transition from top to bottom
examples.useCase: Mobile app landing pages, portfolio showcases, product demos

hoverScrollNotes.rebTranDur: Transition duration in seconds (2-5s recommended, 3s default)
hoverScrollNotes.calculation: Longer images need longer duration (3s for 2000px, 5s for 4000px)
hoverScrollNotes.browserSupport: Works on desktop only, mobile devices see static image

examples.name: MacBook with Live Website iframe
examples.description: Laptop mockup displaying live website via iframe for web design portfolios
examples.visualDescription: Black MacBook Pro with live website preview, clickable iframe, 80% width on desktop
examples.useCase: Web design portfolios, agency showcases, client testimonials

iframeNotes.url: Must be full URL with https://
iframeNotes.target: _blank opens in new tab (recommended for external sites)
iframeNotes.crossOrigin: Some sites block iframe embedding (X-Frame-Options header)
iframeNotes.offset: rebTopOffset and rebLeftOffset position iframe within laptop screen (adjust per device)

offsetGuide.adjustment: Use browser DevTools to fine-tune positioning for pixel-perfect alignment

examples.name: iMac Desktop with FancyBox Popup Gallery
examples.description: Desktop mockup with clickable popup gallery for showcasing multiple screens
examples.visualDescription: iMac minimal white frame, click to open full-screen popup gallery with arrows and thumbnails
examples.useCase: Design portfolios, UI/UX showcases, product galleries with multiple screens

fancyBoxNotes.onClickEfct: popup triggers FancyBox lightbox on click
fancyBoxNotes.LoopFancy: Enable loop to navigate from last to first image
fancyBoxNotes.infobar: Shows current image number (1/5) at top
fancyBoxNotes.TitleFancy: Shows image title from alt text (set false for cleaner look)
fancyBoxNotes.TransitionFancy: slide (default), fade, circular, tube, zoom-in-out, rotate

multipleImagesSetup.note: FancyBox groups all images in gallery automatically
multipleImagesSetup.addMoreImages: Place multiple tp-dynamic-device blocks with same onClickEfct: 'popup'
multipleImagesSetup.grouping: FancyBox auto-detects and creates gallery from adjacent blocks
multipleImagesSetup.manualGrouping: Use FancyOption JSON to set data-fancybox attribute for custom grouping

examples.name: Custom Device Frame with WP Template Content
examples.description: Custom branded device mockup with WordPress template content for unique presentations
examples.visualDescription: Custom device frame PNG with WordPress template content positioned inside, offset for perfect alignment
examples.useCase: Branded device mockups, unique product presentations, custom frame designs

customDeviceSetup.customMedia: Upload custom device frame as PNG with transparent background
customDeviceSetup.frameRequirements: Frame should have empty screen area (transparent or white)
customDeviceSetup.imgWidth_imgHeight: Size of content area within device frame
customDeviceSetup.imgTopOff_imgLeftOff: Offset to position content within frame (measure in Photoshop/Figma)
customDeviceSetup.imgZindex: 1 places content behind frame, -1 places content in front (if frame has overlay)
customDeviceSetup.backendVisi: Show template content in editor (false hides, improves performance)

templateContentNotes.blockTemp: Template slug (create via Nexter > Block Templates)

measurementTips.step1: Open device frame PNG in Photoshop/Figma
measurementTips.step2: Measure screen area top-left corner from frame top-left (imgTopOff, imgLeftOff)
measurementTips.step3: Measure screen area width and height (imgWidth, imgHeight)
measurementTips.step4: Export measurements to attributes, test and fine-tune in editor

examples.name: iPad Tablet with Manual Scrollbar Styling
examples.description: Tablet mockup with long scrollable content and custom-styled scrollbar
examples.visualDescription: White iPad vertical with long article content, custom purple scrollbar with rounded thumb, manual scroll enabled
examples.useCase: Long-form content showcases, article previews, documentation demos

scrollableImageNotes.scrollDimage: Enables scrollable container for tall images
scrollableImageNotes.scrollManual: true = user scrolls manually, false = auto-scroll on hover
scrollableImageNotes.contentHeight: Image should be 2-3x taller than device screen for effective scrolling

scrollbarStyling.thumbRadius: Rounded corners for modern look (10px = fully rounded with 8px width)
scrollbarStyling.trackRadius: Track rounded corners (match thumb for consistency)
scrollbarStyling.browserSupport: Webkit only (Chrome, Safari, Edge). Firefox uses default scrollbar.

accessibilityNotes.contrast: Ensure thumb color contrasts with track (WCAG AA: 3:1 minimum)
accessibilityNotes.size: 8px minimum width for comfortable dragging on touch devices
accessibilityNotes.fallback: Firefox and older browsers use default scrollbar styling

examples.name: Device Carousel - Portfolio Showcase
examples.description: Multi-slide carousel with center mode, scale effect, and pagination for showcasing app screens
examples.visualDescription: 5-slide iPhone carousel, center slide scaled 1.15x, side slides at 0.7 opacity, purple pagination dots
examples.useCase: App portfolios, multi-screen showcases, feature tours, product galleries

carouselSetup.cConImg: Array of image objects with _key (unique identifier for each slide)
carouselSetup.columnSlide: single (1 device per slide) or multi (2-4 devices, set in UI)
carouselSetup.slideSpeed: Transition speed in ms (1000-2000ms recommended, 1500ms default)
carouselSetup.slideInfinite: Loop from last to first slide seamlessly
carouselSetup.slideAutoplaySpeed: Time per slide in ms (3000-5000ms recommended)

centerModeNotes.centerPadding: Space around center slide to show side slides (px value)
centerModeNotes.calculation: 150px shows ~25% of side slides, 80px shows ~15%, 0px shows center only
centerModeNotes.centerSlideEffect: scale (zoom center), shadow (add shadow to center), none
centerModeNotes.slideOpacity: 0.7 = 30% faded side slides (0.5-0.9 recommended, 1.0 = no fade)

paginationNotes.dotsStyle: style-1 to style-7 (style-2 = bordered circles is most popular)
paginationNotes.dotASize: Active dot size (12-18px, should be 1.3-1.5x dotSize)
paginationNotes.dotsTopSpace: Offset from bottom (negative value pushes down, -50px = 50px below carousel)
paginationNotes.colors: dotsBgColor (normal), dotsActiveBgColor (active), border variants for style-2/3/4

performanceConsiderations.imageOptimization: Use optimized JPGs (<200KB per image) for smooth transitions
performanceConsiderations.autoplaySpeed: 3000ms minimum to allow users to view each slide

examples.name: Mobile Device with Animated Icon Badge
examples.description: iPhone mockup with floating animated icon for highlighting features or new releases
examples.visualDescription: Black iPhone with app screenshot, purple circular icon badge (top-right corner) with pulse animation
examples.useCase: New feature announcements, app updates, promotional badges, limited-time offers

iconBadgeNotes.positioning: Icon positioned top-right by default (adjust with CSS if needed)
iconBadgeNotes.iconBdrRadius: 50% = perfect circle for badges, 0 = square, 10-20px = rounded

animationOptions.iconConHoverAnimation: Enable hover-only animation (animates only on device hover)
animationOptions.iconConAniStyle: pulse (scale up/down), floating (up/down movement), tossing (diagonal movement), rotating (360° spin)
animationOptions.iconConAniDuration: Animation cycle duration in seconds (2-4s recommended, 2.5s default)
animationOptions.performance: Continuous animations use CSS animations (60fps, GPU accelerated)

animationGuide.pulse: Best for 'NEW' badges, notifications, attention-grabbing (subtle scale 1.0-1.1)
animationGuide.floating: Best for playful designs, app icons, friendly feel (10-20px vertical movement)
animationGuide.tossing: Best for dynamic effects, excitement, energy (15-25px diagonal movement)
animationGuide.rotating: Best for loading indicators, processing, continuous action (360° rotation)

designTips.iconSize: Keep icon <20% of device width (too large overwhelms mockup)
designTips.transparency: Use PNG with transparent background for clean overlay
designTips.contrast: Ensure icon contrasts with device background (add shadow if needed)
designTips.animation: Use pulse for static badges, floating for playful, hover-only for subtle

examples.name: Mobile Device with Click-to-Link (App Download)
examples.description: Clickable iPhone mockup linking to app store for direct downloads
examples.visualDescription: White iPhone with app screenshot, entire device clickable linking to App Store in new tab
examples.useCase: App landing pages, download CTAs, app store links, mobile product showcases

clickLinkNotes.onClickLink.url: Destination URL (App Store, Google Play, landing page)
clickLinkNotes.onClickLink.target: _blank opens in new tab (recommended for external links), _self same tab
clickLinkNotes.onClickLink.nofollow: SEO attribute (leave empty unless affiliate/untrusted link)
clickLinkNotes.clickableArea: Entire device mockup is clickable (screenshot + frame)
clickLinkNotes.cursor: Device shows pointer cursor on hover (indicates clickability)

appStoreLinks.smartBanner: Detects user device and redirects to correct store (iOS → App Store, Android → Play Store)

hoverEffects.visualFeedback: Hover shadow transition provides clear call-to-action

conversionOptimization.placement: Place above fold on landing pages for maximum visibility
conversionOptimization.context: Add text CTA below device ('Download now' button for clarity)
conversionOptimization.testing: A/B test with/without click link vs standalone download buttons
conversionOptimization.analytics: Track clicks via Google Analytics events or UTM parameters

deviceTypes.mobile: iphone-white-flat, iphone-black-flat, iphone-x-white, iphone-x-black, android-white, android-black
deviceTypes.custom: Upload custom device PNG with transparent screen area

contentTypes.iframe: Live website embed (requires HTTPS, some sites block iframes)
contentTypes.template: WordPress template content (Nexter Block Template slug)

clickEffects.popup: Opens FancyBox lightbox gallery (groups adjacent devices automatically)

layoutTypes.normal: Single device mockup with optional hover scroll, click effects, icons
layoutTypes.carousel: Multiple devices in carousel with pagination, autoplay, center mode effects

validationRules.conIframe.url: Required when contentType='iframe', must be full URL with https://
validationRules.blockTemp: Required when contentType='template', must be valid template slug
validationRules.rebHoverScroll: Only works with contentType='image' and layoutType='normal'

warnings: CRITICAL: iframeTitle is required when using contentType='iframe' for WCAG 2.4.2 compliance
Hover scroll (rebHoverScroll) only works on desktop, mobile users see static image
Some websites block iframe embedding via X-Frame-Options header (test before deploying)
Custom scrollbar styling (thumbBG, trackBG) only works in Webkit browsers (Chrome, Safari, Edge), Firefox uses default
Carousel with many slides (>20) can impact performance, optimize images (<200KB each)
FancyBox popup (onClickEfct='popup') groups adjacent tp-dynamic-device blocks automatically
Custom device frames (deviceType='custom') require precise offset measurements (imgTopOff, imgLeftOff) for alignment
Template content (contentType='template') can slow down editor if template is complex, set backendVisi=false
Autoplay carousels (slideAutoplay=true) should have slideAutoplaySpeed >= 3000ms for accessibility
Continuous icon animations (iconConAni=true) use CPU, limit to 1-2 per page for performance
Center mode carousel (centerPadding > 0) requires deviceWidth >= 80% for side slides to be visible
rebTranDur should scale with image height: 2s for 1500px, 3s for 2500px, 5s for 4000px+
commonMistakes: Forgetting iframeTitle when using iframe content (accessibility violation)
Using rebHoverScroll with iframe or template (only works with images)
Setting imgTopOff/imgLeftOff without measuring from device frame in Photoshop/Figma (misalignment)
Using very tall images without rebHoverScroll or scrollDimage (content cuts off)
Setting centerslideScale too high (>1.3) makes carousel look jarring
Using dotsTopSpace positive value (pushes pagination up into carousel, should be negative)
Not optimizing carousel images (<200KB each) causing slow transitions
Setting slideAutoplaySpeed too fast (<3000ms) prevents users from viewing slides
Using contentType='iframe' without testing for X-Frame-Options blocking
Not adding _key to cConImg array items (carousel slides won't render correctly)
bestPractices: Use rebHoverScroll for tall screenshots (>1500px height) to showcase full content
Always set target='_blank' for external iframe URLs (better user experience)
Optimize carousel images to <200KB each for smooth transitions
Use center mode carousel (centerPadding + scale effect) for dramatic app showcases
Set slideAutoplaySpeed to 3000-5000ms for comfortable viewing
Use shapeHshadow (hover shadow) for clickable devices to indicate interactivity
Test iframe URLs in incognito mode to check for X-Frame-Options blocking
Use iconConAniStyle='pulse' for attention-grabbing badges, 'floating' for playful designs
Set dotsStyle='style-2' for modern bordered pagination dots
Use deviceWidth 35-45% for mobile, 60-80% for laptop/desktop (responsive sizing)
Add UTM parameters to onClickLink URLs for tracking (?utm_source=website&utm_medium=device_mockup)
Use backendVisi=false for template content to improve editor performance
accessibilityNotes: iframeTitle is REQUIRED when using iframe content (WCAG 2.4.2: Page Titled)
Ensure click links (onClickEfct='link') have descriptive surrounding text (not just 'click here')
Autoplay carousels should allow manual control (navigation arrows or dots)
Custom scrollbar colors must meet WCAG AA contrast ratio 3:1 (thumb vs track)
Provide alt text for conImage (set in WordPress media library)
Hover-only effects (rebHoverScroll, iconConHoverAnimation) should have touch alternatives
FancyBox popups should be keyboard navigable (arrows, Esc to close) - built-in by default
Avoid continuous animations (iconConAni) for users with vestibular disorders (use hover-only)
Test with screen readers: device mockups should convey purpose (alt text, surrounding context)
performanceConsiderations: Optimize screenshot images: Use JPG at 80% quality, <300KB per image
Carousel: Limit to 20 slides maximum, use lazy loading (automatic)
Iframe embeds: Heavy sites (lots of JS) can slow page load, consider static images instead
Template content: Keep templates lightweight (<50KB), use backendVisi=false in editor
Continuous animations: Limit to 1-2 per page (iconConAni uses CPU)
Hover scroll: Works via CSS transform (GPU accelerated, no performance impact)
Custom scrollbar: Webkit scrollbar styling has no performance impact
FancyBox: Loads library on first click (lazy load), no impact until popup opened
Responsive images: Use deviceWidth % values to avoid loading oversized images on mobile
Shadow effects: drop-shadow is GPU accelerated, minimal performance impact

troubleshooting.cause: Target website has X-Frame-Options: DENY or SAMEORIGIN header
troubleshooting.solution: Use screenshot image instead, or contact site owner to whitelist your domain

troubleshooting.cause: contentType not set to 'image', or image not tall enough
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure contentType='image', rebHoverScroll=true, image height > device screen height
Measure screen position from device frame in Photoshop/Figma, adjust offsets precisely
Add unique _key to each image object: {url: '...', _key: 'slide1'}
Test in Chrome/Safari/Edge, ensure scrollManual=true and scrollDimage=true
Set showIcon=true and upload icon to iconSrc.url
Set onClickEfct='link' and provide full URL in onClickLink.url

troubleshooting.problem: Pagination dots not showing in carousel
troubleshooting.cause: showDots={md: false} or dotsTopSpace too large negative value
troubleshooting.solution: Set showDots={md: true}, adjust dotsTopSpace to -30 to -60px range
